span.a: The FAA is expected to propose rules on commercial-drone use that would limit flights and require operators to hold licenses.
Samsung is considering a major leadership shake-up after a year that saw its profitability, market share and stock prices slide.
Money managers urge caution about investing in IPOs of some energy-focused master limited partnerships.
Legal observers say the outcome of the AIG trial may hinge on the issue of the scope of government authority.
The EU is set to unveil a fund in a bid to spark at least $372 billion of added investment in Europe’s economy.
Electric utilities, saying they are running short of coal, are pressing BNSF Railway to speed up deliveries.
BofA is under attack by a faith-based shareholder group over combining the jobs of chairman and CEO.
Asian stocks surged early Monday in the wake of Beijing’s surprise rate cut. Hong Kong shares jumped 1.7%.
American Airlines and its pilots union said they would continue to negotiate terms of a labor agreement.
Art buyers snapped up Japanese and Southeast Asian works at a Hong Kong Christie’s sale totaling $82 million.
The latest “Hunger Games” movie posted the biggest box-office opening of the year but fell short of its target.
The U.S. and other powers said it would be virtually impossible to reach a nuclear deal with Iran by Monday’s deadline and favor extending talks.
Tunisian politician Beji Caid Essebsi was widely expected to defeat 21 other candidates in the country’s first democratic presidential election.
Bahrain’s Shiite opposition blasted government claims that over half of registered voters took part in elections.
Putin said he doesn’t seek to be Russia’s president for life but doesn’t rule out seeking another term in 2018.
A suicide bombing struck a volleyball tournament in eastern Afghanistan, killing 45 to 60 spectators.
Doctors at a Boston hospital discussed the risks of a tool used in hysterectomies in 2011 but continued to use morcellators for two more years.
Protests continued through the weekend in Ferguson, Mo., as a grand jury was set to reconvene in the police shooting case.
The wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 left a separatist area of Ukraine, bound for the Netherlands.
A 12-year-old Cleveland boy who was shot by police when he allegedly reached for a BB gun died Sunday morning; The University of Virginia suspended fraternal activities amid a sex-assault probe.
Died: Marion Barry, 78, controversial four-term mayor of Washington, D.C.
